sense.name: go/come back to a location
sense.examples: He returned from Germany last night. He returned to his ex-wife. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. returned to Atlanta. She returned to her office after lunch.

sense.name: give back, pass to
sense.examples: She returned the twenty dollars she borrowed last week. With no heirs, the land will likely return to the state. A final report should be returned to the council by tomorrow.

sense.name: respond, react
sense.examples: He is returning the favor by letting her use the summer house. She returned his insult before he could walk away. I will return your call as soon as possible.

sense.name: render
sense.examples: Have they returned a verdict yet? The operation returns a string. How much will his bond return in five years? This rich land will return a bountiful crop every year.

sense.name: sports: return pass
sense.commentary: Note: very specific subsense of sense 3.
sense.examples: John returned the ball before the opposing team could steal it away. She returned his backhand.

sense.name: go/come back to a state or practice, restore, revive
sense.commentary: Note: unlike sense 1, here final destination is abstract, not concrete location.
sense.examples: After the war, they returned to their farming. She is gradually returning to the traditions of her homeland. Her old vigor has returned. The local man returned to office after four years out of politics. He returned to loving his ex-wife.
